lines.text: Look, what can you tell in four days?

I'll tell ya what I can tell. I can tell ya that three times a day I get hungry and every twenty-four hours I get an irresistible urge to go to sleep in a bed. I don't wanna beg and I don't wanna steal. I don't want a cop tellin' me I'm a vagrant and runnin' me outta town. I'm sorry to desert you, but I'm not cut out for this kind of a life.
Listen, Dad, you're always coming to me about Mother. Why don't you go to her for me and explain to her that I'm not a boy anymore.

[After the roadwork is stopped]
That a mile?
Sure. We do a 100 yards to a mile.
Uh, I'm crazy...Ever been crazy, kid?
No. How's it get ya?

[Confused and disoriented]
I don't kn...I don't know. See, ya...ya know...see, when you got it, then...that means ya don't know about it...
One more, bottlekeeper!

[finishes the drink in front of him]
Better make it two!

[noticing the bartender's impatience]
We keeping you up?
Yes, sir!

[sarcastically]
The wages of gin!
You've already had twelve drinks. How can you be thirsty?

[Clasping the side of Nick's face]
It's an emotional thirst, not a physical one. You wouldn't understand.

[to Nick as he is leaving]
You, uh, find yourself a buddy - your own kind of buddy. A man alone has no damn chance, you hear?
I'd hate like hell to donate you to a war that doesn't even concern us. It's bad enough to die for your own country!
Well, Nick, what's a young man's reality is just an older man's dream. Old men dream dreams. Young men see visions.
Ah, couldn't be worse! There's nothing worse than war!
Defeat is worse!
I don't believe it! What is defeat? You go home!
War is very hard on a peaceful swordsman.
Ma, the difference between you and me grows fifty miles each day.
